relation: Invocation site is not the master definition site.
New value already exists in the priority group.
Specified master group does not exist.
Specified priority group does not exist.
New value has the incorrect data type for the priority group.
Specified value has the incorrect data type for the priority group.
Specified master group is not quiesced.
textBeforeTable: Table 18-26 ALTER_PRIORITY_datatype Procedure Exceptions Exceptions New value that you want assigned to the priority group member. new_value     Current value of the priority group member.  old_value     Name of the priority group containing the value that you want to alter.  pgroup     Master group with which the priority group is associated.  gname      Description Parameter   Table 18-25 ALTER_PRIORITY_datatype Procedure Parameters  Parameters  | NVARCHAR2 } | NCHAR | RAW | DATE | CHAR | VARCHAR2 { NUMBER  where datatype:  new_value IN datatype); old_value IN datatype, pgroup IN VARCHAR2, gname IN VARCHAR2, DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_PRIORITY_datatype (  Syntax Oracle Database Advanced ReplicationChapter 6, "Configuring Conflict Resolution" See Also:  This procedure alters the value of a member in a priority group.     for more information about conflict resolution methods  and
textAfterTable: ALTER_SITE_PRIORITY Procedure This procedure alters the priority level associated with a specified site. You must call this procedure from the master definition site. See Also: Chapter 6, "Configuring Conflict Resolution" and Oracle Database Advanced Replication for more information about conflict resolution methods Syntax  DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_SITE_PRIORITY ( gname IN VARCHAR2, name IN VARCHAR2, old_priority IN NUMBER, new_priority IN NUMBER); Parameters Table 18-27 ALTER_SITE_PRIORITY Procedure Parameters Parameter Description  gname Master group with which the site priority group is associated.  name Name of the site priority group whose member you are altering.  old_priority Current priority level of the site whose priority level you want to change.  new_priority New priority level for the site. A higher number indicates a higher priority level. Exceptions
